Sincerely, a pissed off Uber driver.
Again, this is about what's fair. The way how Uber is treating their drivers is not just unfair, it seems borderline illegal.
And tip your drivers. You are a stranger in somebody's car. It costs on average $0.54/mile for us to drive our own cars between everything.
If Uber *MATCHES* what we were making this time 16 months ago, then we'll talk about me opening the door for someone.
And after almost 1300 rides in the last year and a half I got a strike for not opening the door for somebody.
Oh and as a driver, if you let a ride go no matter how far away it is, it affects your acceptance rate, even if the pickup point is 30 min.
So take a look at those screenshots of the rides I'm talking about and tell me they're not red. Red = Surge. Plain and simple.
I will not be taken advantage of without a fight https://t.co/cNfqIJZkbh

Check out the emails I've been sending Uber and the responses I've been getting. It should've been a simple answer but then again, who am I?
I might be partially colorblind but that is fucking red. It couldn't get more red than that. I don't take photos of ride arrivals for fun.
Between my tweets yesterday and emailing back-and-forth, Uber is trying to convince me that these were in fact not surge rides.
Recently I had 2 rides in the Glendale area that were clearly in red zones (addresses altered for privacy). Look... https://t.co/3n4S1hOmyq
Drivers thrive on being in areas that show up as red on a map that indicate a higher (or "Surge") rate, especially these days.
Usually I wouldn't make this big of a deal over something like this, but since the fares are now $0.80/mile & $0.15/min average, it's enough
I'm glad there are drivers out there that do drive late at night because we need them... I just fear for my safety and condition of my car.
